name: Vega Sicilia Único
description: A legendary Spanish red wine with deep complexity and elegant aging potential.
tastingNotes: Dark berries, tobacco, leather, and earthy tones.
pairingSuggestions: Pairs well with grilled lamb and aged cheeses.

name: La Rioja Alta Gran Reserva 904
description: Aged Rioja with velvety tannins and hints of tobacco and dark berries.
tastingNotes: Vanilla, dried fruit, and hints of spice.
pairingSuggestions: Pairs well with roasted meats and manchego cheese.

name: Cava Codorníu Clasico
description: A lively Spanish Cava with fine bubbles and citrusy freshness.
tastingNotes: Crisp citrus, green apple, and toasted almond.
pairingSuggestions: Perfect with seafood, tapas, and light salads.

name: Quinta do Crasto Reserva
description: A bold and structured Portuguese red with rich black fruit and spice notes.
tastingNotes: Blackberry, plum, spice, and subtle oak.
pairingSuggestions: Pairs well with grilled meats, game, and rich pasta dishes.

name: Vinho Verde Soalheiro
description: A zesty and mineral-driven white wine with fresh citrus flavors.
tastingNotes: Lemon zest, green apple, and a touch of minerality.
pairingSuggestions: Best with shellfish, sushi, and fresh salads.

name: Porto Ramos Pinto 10 Year Old
description: A rich and smooth Portuguese port wine with nutty and caramel flavors.
tastingNotes: Dried fruits, caramel, and toasted nuts.
pairingSuggestions: Ideal with dark chocolate, blue cheese, and nuts.

name: Château Margaux
description: One of Bordeaux’s finest, known for its elegance, silky tannins, and aging potential.
tastingNotes: Blackcurrant, violet, cedar, and fine tannins.
pairingSuggestions: Pairs beautifully with filet mignon and roasted lamb.

name: Chablis Premier Cru
description: A crisp and mineral-driven Chardonnay from the Burgundy region.
tastingNotes: Citrus, white peach, and flinty minerality.
pairingSuggestions: Excellent with oysters, grilled fish, and goat cheese.

name: Moët & Chandon Brut Impérial
description: A famous French Champagne with fine bubbles and creamy elegance.
tastingNotes: Green apple, brioche, and floral hints.
pairingSuggestions: Perfect with caviar, soft cheeses, and strawberries.

name: Barolo Marchesi di Barolo
description: A rich and intense Italian red with floral aromas and a long-lasting finish.
tastingNotes: Rose, cherry, tar, and earthy undertones.
pairingSuggestions: Pairs well with truffle pasta, braised meats, and aged cheeses.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Biondi Santi
description: A structured and long-lived Tuscan red with deep cherry and spice flavors.
tastingNotes: Dark cherry, leather, tobacco, and spice.
pairingSuggestions: Great with roasted lamb, wild boar, and hard cheeses.

name: Franciacorta Bellavista
description: An Italian sparkling wine with rich complexity and vibrant acidity.
tastingNotes: Ripe pear, almond, and fresh citrus.
pairingSuggestions: Enjoy with seafood risotto, antipasti, and soft cheeses.
